intro: Paraderris glauca, commonly known as the blue paraderris, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to South Africa. It features small, narrow leaves that are typically a bluish-green color, which helps it reflect sunlight and reduce water loss. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in spring, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. It is well adapted to rocky and sandy soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
